Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Chen met the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Mr. Chen's evidence was found incomplete and misleading
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistent and insufficient evidence regarding residency
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Citizenship application hearing and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide credible and consistent evidence of residency
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must demonstrate physical presence for at least 1,095 days
Crimes.Application_Factor: Conflicting evidence about location during claimed residency period
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of the citizenship judge’s factual findings
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in financial and communication records suggesting presence abroad
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed standard administrative review procedures
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant provided conflicting information about whereabouts
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Mr. Chen challenged the reasonableness of the judge’s conclusion
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or substantiate periods of absence

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Chen provided sufficient and credible evidence to meet the residency requirement
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Information provided was inconsistent and unreliable
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement due to misleading evidence
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Citizenship application hearing and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Submission of incomplete and conflicting evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must prove physical presence for at least 1,095 days with credible evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Discrepancies across multiple forms of personal activity records
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of the citizenship judge’s assessment of credibility
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Providing misleading and incomplete evidence regarding residency
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictory travel, financial, and digital footprint evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process adhered to procedural fairness standards
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Multiple inconsistencies in reported activities versus documented behavior
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Mr. Chen contested the credibility findings of the judge
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to accurately report periods of absence from Canada
